entry.title: Re: Target hours not appearing in Manage My Timesheet
entry.content:
1. Ensure that availability data is updated for the employee. This can be checked via CDS View I_TimeOverviewByWrkAgrmtAndDte. 
  2. If the system is not integrated with SuccessFactors, update the availability data using the API_MANAGE_WF_AVAILABILITY.

Refer to KBA 3654922

entry.title: Re: DRC eDocument Cockpit - Message EDOCUMENT006
entry.content:
Hello @SebastianB 

EDOCUMENT006 occurs when the system is unable to create a new entry in EDOCUMENTHISTORY. Please verify the Sequence No. in the eDocument Status/History.

For 999: this is a hard limit by design, so further actions (such as cancel, void, or resubmit) are not possible. Please reverse the source document and create a new eDocument use Manage Billing Documents to cancel.

SAP Community-eDocument History reached sequence No. 999 – What now?

SAP Help Portal-Cancelling Billing Documents

If the value is below 999, stop any Schedule eDocument Jobs that are retrying the same document and try once more. If it still fails, raise an SAP incident (CA-GTF-CSC-EDO) with the eDocument GUID and screenshots; Support can correct the insert issue.

SAP Help Portal-Schedule eDocument Jobs - General  

SAP Support Portal-3595486 - Exception 'Error while inserting record into table EDOCUMENTHISTORY' in eDocument

For long-term housekeeping, you can SAP Help-Archive eDocuments with the archiving object EDOCUMENT.

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: Cash-Flow Report with Document Types
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I am currently working on a Group Reporting project on private cloud. 
The decision has been taken with the business that the standard SAP Pre-delivered Cash-Flow statement will not be used, instead we will need to build a custom cash-flow report and use the "Document Type" field from ACDOCA to perform the groupings on the cash-flow report. 

In the current configuration i see we can use only "Transaction Types" and "Functional Areas" when handling the reporting rules of the Cash-Flow statement. Any insights on how to bring the "Document Type" to ACCODU and use in reporting structure?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Audit Report/Tracking of "Budget Override" Functionality
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have identified the need for control and traceability in the “Budget Override” functionality within the Compensation module of SAP SuccessFactors. At the moment, we have not found an option to extract an audit report or track the changes/information recorded in this functionality.

Therefore, we would like to request:

1) Confirmation on whether the system provides any native report that allows auditing the use of the “Budget Override” functionality.
2) If not, whether there are any alternatives to perform this tracking, either via Ad Hoc, Stories, or through APIs.
3) Guidance on best practices to monitor and audit the information entered in Budget Override.

This tracking is essential for governance and internal audit purposes in our project, to ensure greater transparency in the budget management process.

Thank you in advance for your support, and we look forward to your guidance.

SAP SuccessFactors Compensation

entry.title: Re: Simulation Locked for editing
entry.content:
Hi Sanchia,

When an author edits a content object in Producer or Manager, they take editing control of that object.  In many instances, they also take editing control of the parent object being edited, which is likely a folder.  As soon as authors finish making changes to an object, they must give back editing control, i.e. Finish Editing the object, and also the parent object.  They should not retain editing control of objects that they are not editing because this prevents other authors from editing that content. 

You will not be able to modify the existing Simulation or create new Simulations in the folder until that current author gives back editing control of those objects.  Every author should do this every time.

If the author that has editing control of the Simulation and its parent folder is no longer available to give back editing control, an Administrator can cancel the current control that the author has over the objects.  To do this, the Administrator must click on the folder object in Manager and select More > Cancel Editing All Objects.  Be aware that this will result in the loss of the changes that have been made by the other author if those changes have not been synchronized to Manager.

Regards
Shane

entry.title: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently running an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (version 2508, Colombia localization) implementation project and have encountered the following situation:

  • During the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC), we advanced through the Fit-to-Standard workshops and proceeded to load the Finance scope items.

  • Upon validation, we noticed that some scope items selected in the DDA are no activated (e.g., 1GB, 1GF, 33M, 3M4, BGC) we find out that they were retired or absorbed into other processes.

  • When trying to load the scopes through a JSON file, the full Baseline gets re-activated. This includes scope items that are not needed for our specific business case.

Our questions are:

  1. Is it necessary or mandatory to always work with the full Baseline in implementation projects, even if it contains scope items that do not apply to the customer?

  2. What is the recommended approach in such cases?

    • Proceed with the Baseline including the “extra” scopes?

    • Or manually select only the scope items strictly required for the business?

  3. What is the best practice to avoid inconsistencies in CBC when loading/adjusting scopes via JSON, considering that this automatically re-activates the baseline?

We would greatly appreciate guidance from the community (or SAP directly) on the recommended way forward in these scenarios, as we want to ensure the configuration complies with the standard and avoids rework later on.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
The introduction of SAP Universal ID was a significant improvement, especially with the ability to log in using a single email ID instead of remembering multiple S-User IDs. It greatly simplified access and improved efficiency.

However, with the recent changes, it has become challenging for users like us, who manage multiple partnerships as part of a central team and need to switch between 15+ S-User IDs regularly. This has now become a burden and, more importantly, a productivity downgrade.

It would be extremely helpful if SAP could reconsider this approach or provide an alternate solution—for example, allowing users to easily pick from multiple IDs that are clearly annotated during login. This would significantly improve usability and reduce friction for power users managing multiple accounts.

Thank you for considering this feedback.

entry.title: Re: SET UP PRIMARY FINANCE SETTINGS IN SAP CBC (Central B...
entry.content:
Hello @Melle1028 

Thanks for the clear questions. Here’s what is recommended for SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Edition (CBC):

Primary Fiscal Year Variant (FYV) in CBC

When you select K4 (calendar year, 4 special periods) in Specify Primary Finance Settings, it sets the FYV for the leading ledger (0L) across the entire system and cannot be changed after saving or posting. Choose K4 if your statutory or group reporting is done on a calendar-year basis. SAP Learning: Selecting Finance Settings and Building the Organisational Structure

 SAP Help Portal-Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant

Academic-year reporting that may change year to year

Best option: retain K4 for 0L and model the academic year in analytics like CDS/report mapping months to academic periods. This sidesteps ledger constraints and allows you to adjust the mapping each year without altering core finance settings. (Conceptual best practice; CBC still uses the K4 system wide.

Non-leading ledger with an Alternative FYV 2L

It is technically feasible, but only if you assign the Alternative FYV before any postings in the company code or ledger. There are restrictions and dependencies you must review first. Use this option only if you genuinely need ledger-based accounting outside the standard calendar year. SAP Help Portal-Restrictions and Dependencies

Using FYV “SZ – Configurable template variant”

SZ is SAP’s template to define your own FYV (year-dependent). It’s the standard way to model non-calendar fiscal/academic years. Maintain the definition per fiscal year and do not change definitions for years with postings. If your legal/management year aligns with the academic calendar, you can select SZ as the primary FYV in CBC and maintain it each year upfront. SAP Help Portal-Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant

Practical recommendation

For legal or group reporting, if it's based on a calendar year, choose K4 as the primary and handle academic-year views in analytics.

Consider SZ as the primary option for year-dependent maintenance if legal and management reporting truly follow the academic year. Alternatively, use 2L with an Alternative FYV set up beforehand and validate the scope and limits

Help SAP documentation

Specify Primary Finance Settings (cannot be changed after saving; system-wide setting). SAP Learning-Selecting Finance Settings and Building the Organizational Structure

Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant (overview and where FYV is set in CBC). SAP Help Portal-Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year Variant

Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant (use SZ template). SAP Help Portal-Defining Your Own Fiscal Year Variant

Alternative Fiscal Year Variant – Restrictions and Dependencies. SAP Help Portal-Restrictions and Dependencies

Alternative Fiscal Year Variant – Effects/assignment to local ledger. SAP Help Portal Alternative Fiscal Year Variant and Its Effects on Transactions

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@PraveenJelli : check note: 3634421 - Replication Flow - transferring data failed due to error with object - SAP Datasphere

To resolve this, investigate the job log in SM37, SLG1,DHCDCMON,DHADM and ST22 for similar errors to identify mismatched elements. You may need to restrict the source with known filters, correct the target table's data types in SAP Datasphere, recreate the Replication Flow, and mark the existing target table as final. Better to raise a support ticket as this not the right platform, please use the support team 😀

entry.title: Re: How to use aggregated value of a Z Condition Type aut...
entry.content:
Hello Abul,

It's not possible to transfer the header value of ZPR1 to ZPMO by standard configuration. To achieve something close to this, you can use custom logic (BAdI for Alternative Calculation of Condition Amount) and set ZPMO's amount based on the value of ZPR1.

If you require ZPMO to also display a non zero rate (KBETR), then the implementation must calculate a rate using a defined base (for example, per 1 unit). Otherwise, you can map the aggregated header amount into the Condition Amount of ZPMO.

entry.title: Scope items included in DDA but not available in CBC – Guidance needed (S/4HANA Cloud Public 2508)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (release 2508, Colombia localization) project and have encountered an issue related to scope items availability:

During our Fit-to-Standard workshops and the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA), the following scope items were included in our functional package:

  • 1GB – Asset Accounting with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 1GF – Assets Under Construction with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 33M – Revenue Recognition – Sell from Stock (IFRS)

  • 3M4 – Revenue Recognition – Service Documents (IFRS)

  • BGC – Fiori Analytical Apps for General Ledger

  • 2JB – SAP Fiori Analytical Apps for Financial Accounting

  • 1GI – General Ledger Allocation Cycle

However, when moving forward with the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC) and in Signavio Process Navigator, we noticed that these scope items are not available for selection.

This raises uncertainty on how to proceed, and we would like to ask the community for guidance:

  1. Have these scope items been officially retired in release 2508, and are their capabilities already integrated into other scope items (e.g., Universal Parallel Accounting, Universal Allocation, or Fiori analytical catalogs)?

  2. Is there any alternative procedure to enable them in CBC?

  3. If they have been replaced, what are the successor scope items or the best practice recommended to cover these functionalities in the project?

Our main goal is to ensure that the scope defined in DDA is properly reflected in CBC, without leaving functional gaps or including obsolete scope items.

Any guidance from the community (or SAP experts) on the best way forward would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Audit Report/Tracking of "Budget Override" Functionality
entry.content:
Hi @rogercosta 

I must say I never use that feature since we can build dynamic budgets at employee level that roll up dynamically (hence capture everything correctly when an employee moves from one worksheet from another in terms of budget envelope and spent) while allowing executives or HR to exceed budget through executive review if they need to. I would rather keep the leading practice design I just explained and create a separate budget only for executives or HR (only visible by them) for them to make adjustments.

But I just looked into this feature and found this KBA:  https://me.sap.com/notes/2084180

 

Reporting on Overrides

There are a number of reports available to validate Variable Pay data. Go to: Admin Center> Compensation Home > Select correct plan > Plan Setup > Validation Reports.

 

I will try to turn it on later in my demo environment but maybe you can already look at this lead "Validation Reports".

 

Thanks

Xavier

entry.title: Re: Issues with Crystal Reports 2025 Patch 4 (Designer Crashes, Object Resizing Bug, and Selection L
entry.content:
Here is a more detailed description of the situation:

  • Report structure includes:
    • Page Header
    • Details a
    • Details b
    • Details c
    • Page Footer
    • 3 or more SubReports
    • Various Text, Field, Line, and Formula objects

The challenge is that this issue does not occur every time.
It never happens when copying multiple Text objects, but it does seem to occur consistently when copying and pasting multiple Lines or Boxes.

Because of this, I have developed the habit of always saving the report before performing copy/paste operations on multiple Lines.

I also wonder if there is any way to select only Text and Field objects at once.

Thank you for your support.

Vishal V

entry.title: Re: Read PDF Information And Display Details in Smart Forms
entry.content:
Hello Karthik,

There is no standard program which can achieve your requirement
but there is 3rd party converter which can convert PDF to RTF,
for example:https://www.freeconvert.com/pdf-to-rtf
you can then create standard text from Tcd:SO10,upload the generated
RTF file into the SO10 standard text,this text can be used in any smartform.

Best Regards
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Pros & Cons of using Stand-alone SLT vs Embedded SLT
entry.content:
2.3 Location of the SAP LT Replication Server System
Before beginning the installation, it is important to understand the various system landscape options:

  • We recommend installing SAP LT Replication Server as a separate system.
  • For ABAP-based SAP source systems, SAP LT Replication Server can also be used within the source system.
  • For ABAP-based SAP target systems (for example a Central Finance system), SAP LT Replication Server can also be used within the target system.

Installing the SAP LT Replication Server as a separate system is recommended for the following reasons:

  • It allows a clear separation of concerns - the SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server system will only replicate data and all system resources are dedicated to this.
  • It allows a different set of users to be the single users to have access to the system (security aspects).
  • It allows independent planning of upgrade cycles or other maintenance activities on the SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server system. For example, this will avoid downtime in the Central Finance system if any maintenance activities need to be done in the SAP LT Replication Server system.
  • It supports the independent sizing of servers and allows you to manage performance efficiently.
  • It helps to keep an overview of the system landscape if multiple source systems are connected to one or more target systems.

Installing (and using) the SAP LT Replication Server in the source or target system is only recommended:

  • If there are so few replication use cases, that an additional system is too expensive (for example if you replicate data from
    one source system to SAP Central Finance and there are no plans to expand the scope of the scenario). 

You can find more details via the below link to SLT Installation Guide.

entry.title: Re: UI.SelectionVariant how to reference login user in fi...
entry.content:
@YOJAN 

Use CDS Declarative Authorization
1. First, define your entity with the createdBy field in your CDS model (schema.cds or service.cds):

cds
using { cuid, managed } from '@sap/cds/common';

entity Certificates : cuid, managed {
name : String(255);
description : String;
// createdBy and modifiedBy are automatically managed by 'managed' aspect
}
2. Create security annotations (security.cds or add to existing model):

cds
using { MyService } from './path-to-your-service';

annotate MyService.Certificates with @(
restrict:
);
3. For UI default filtering (optional), use this in your annotations.cds:

cds
annotate service MyService with @(
UI.SelectionVariant #MyCertificates: {
Text: 'My Own Certificates',
SelectOptions: [
{
PropertyName: 'createdBy',
Ranges: [
{
Sign: #I,
Option: #EQ,
Low: { $user.id } // Correct syntax for UI default
}
]
}
]
}
);
Key Points:
Security First: The @restrict annotation ensures server-side enforcement that cannot be bypassed

Automatic User Tracking: The managed aspect automatically populates createdBy and modifiedBy

UI Default: The $user.id in SelectionVariant provides a user-friendly default filter

Required Configuration:
In your package.json, ensure you have:

json
{
"cds": {
"requires": {
"auth": {
"kind": "xsuaa"
}
}
}
}

The @restrict annotation with $user is the canonical CAP way to implement user-specific data access and should always be your primary security mechanism.

entry.title: Re: Cant send EULAs via the place order app
entry.content:
As I checked , I can see your issue occurs in Sales & Marketing Card which belongs to SAP for Me Partner Dashboard.

Unfortunately, we here at SAP Support do not have relevant authorization to support SAP for Me Partner Dashboards or any of the related partner cards.

The authorizations required for Partner Dashboards are different than Customer Dashboards.

In order to get the full benefits of SAP for Me, ensure that you contact your Partner Security Manager/Partner user admin to provide you with the permissions you need for your specific role.

To get further help, please see this KBA for more info:

3165784 - How to get assistance for Partner Dashboards and the related partner cards - SAP for Me

Kind Regards

SAP Support

 

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content: it is mandatory. The full baseline scope is not a suggestion; it is the foundational, pre-configured solution designed by SAP. It represents a bundle of integrated best practices that ensure system integrity, stability, and upgradeability. Attempting to de-select parts of it is unsupported and will lead to the inconsistencies you are experiencing.

entry.title: Re: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content: The only recommended and supported approach is to: Proceed with the full Baseline as your starting foundation. Consider any "extra" scopes as part of the pre-integrated standard that ensures all dependencies are met. For your specific business needs, you then add only the necessary delta scope items on top of this baseline using the correct tool.

entry.title: Re: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection – What’s the Best Practice?
entry.content: Stop using JSON files for scope overwrites. The JSON import feature is causing your system to revert to the baseline as a protective measure to maintain a "clean core." The best practice is to use the system's built-in "Changes via Edit" function within the CBC UI for all scope modifications after the initial baseline activation.

Dan

entry.title: Re: Chart of Accounts Selection
entry.content: COA query suggestion from AI tool, pls valid the customer's real business and make the decision. 在SAP S/4HANA Cloud公有云版本中，关于会计科目表的选择，SAP基于项目经验提供以下建议： 推荐使用标准YCOA科目体系 SAP强烈推荐采用标准的YCOA（运营会计科目表）体系，而不是完全自定义的科目表。主要原因包括： • 标准化优势：SAP S/4HANA Cloud公有云版本是标准化的快速解决方案，其最大优势之一是提供了大量SAP标准内容，包括会计科目表，客户无需执行冗长的配置活动清单，而是可以直接采用标准流程，所有流程都能开箱即用 [1] • 技术限制：在S/4HANA Cloud公有云版本中，无法创建新的会计科目表来替换标准的运营会计科目表YCOA。推荐的做法是根据客户需求调整标准会计科目表YCOA [2] 科目映射和扩展策略 对于PCE现有科目体系的处理，SAP建议： 科目数量差异处理 当客户现有科目数量远超标准科目时（如1000+个科目对应700个标准科目），可以采用以下策略： • 业务挑战：质疑业务部门为什么需要在总账科目层面保持如此详细的分类，建议将详细信息通过项目/WBS等维度进行分析，而在总账层面保持最少必要的科目数量 [3] • 创建新科目：可以根据需要创建新的科目账户，大多数项目都会这样做。可以通过工作清单创建新的总账科目 [3] 科目编号策略 在添加新科目时，建议： • 编号规则：可以使用41000001、41000010或41000100等编号方式，关键是定义自己的规则并在相关配置应用中维护，确保不与其他组重叠 [4] • 冲突保护：如果SAP后续添加与客户相同编号的新科目，客户的科目不会被更新，SAP的新科目会被默认重新编号以保护已使用的现有科目 [4] 项目实施考量角度 基于SAP项目经验，其他公司通常从以下角度考量科目体系选择： 业务连续性 • 评估现有业务流程对特定科目结构的依赖程度 • 分析报告需求和合规要求 实施复杂度 • 标准科目体系的采用可以显著降低实施复杂度和时间 • 自定义程度越高，维护成本越高 长期维护 • 标准科目体系可以更好地支持SAP的持续创新和功能更新 • 减少升级和扩展时的冲突风险 建议的实施路径 1. 评估现有科目：分析PCE现有科目的业务必要性 2. 映射标准科目：将必要的业务科目映射到YCOA标准科目 3. 适度扩展：仅在业务确实需要时创建新的科目 4. 统一编号规则：建立清晰的科目编号规则以避免未来冲突 通过这种平衡的方法，既能满足PCE的业务需求，又能充分利用SAP标准化的优势。

entry.title: Re: Testing API call with in Ariba Developer and postman
entry.content: @isunsai you absolutely need an administrative action, but it must be performed in the Ariba Developer Portal, not the Ariba Supplier Portal. The 401 error is an authorization failure at the API gateway level, not a user permissions issue within your sourcing tenant.The primary reason for your 401 error is almost certainly that your application's request to use the "Supplier Data API" has not been formally approved, and the critical OAuth Secret has not been generated by a user with the Organization Admin role.

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration SuiteのAI Adapterの使い方 Vol2.基本編
entry.content:
@rajeshps 
The final step is to output the log. I wrote the following Groovy script.

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import java.util.HashMap;

def Message processData(Message message)
{   
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String;
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message);
    if(messageLog != null)
    {
        messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("log1",body,"text/plain");
    }
    return message;
}

entry.title: Re: Suser Issiue
entry.content:
Hi Cigdem,

The issue arises because your S-user currently lacks the required authorization for the Cloud installation number 2132xxxx. As outlined in KBA 2598170, S-users must have the "Display Cloud Data" authorization at the Cloud installation number level, in addition to standard case authorizations, to view support cases for this installation. 

Typically, you would need to reach out to your administrator listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to have the authorization reassigned. More information about the authorization 'Display Cloud Data', pls refer to KBA 2598170 - What is the Display Cloud Data authorization? - SAP for Me

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us.

Have a nice day!

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Reassign Test Cases to Process in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
One of the most common challenges in SAP Cloud ALM Test Management is ensuring that manual test cases are correctly linked to the right process. Until recently, if a test case was created without a process assignment, or with the wrong one, there was no straightforward way to fix it. You needed to delete it and recreate it.

With the latest update, SAP Cloud ALM now allows you to reassign a test case to the correct process.

When you reassign a test case:

  • All predefined activities related to the original process flow diagram are reclassified as custom activities.
  • Activities related to the new process flow diagram are automatically added to your structure.

This ensures the test case is properly aligned with the correct solution process while keeping any work you may have already done.

Why This Matters

In the blog about mass upload of test cases, I highlighted in a comment a limitation: during mass uploads using Excel, it is not possible to assign test cases directly to processes because we don't have a process ID.

This meant that after mass upload, test cases were orphans, without an assignment to a process. The new reassign functionality does not fully solve the gap in the mass upload, but it offers a practical way to correct process assignments afterwards. The bad part is that it needs to be done one by one.

To reassign a test case, open it and click Reassign in the up right corner.

 

This enhancement makes test management in SAP Cloud ALM more flexible and helps reduce the manual effort needed when test cases are assigned to the wrong process. It’s not necessary to recreate the test case for that. And it allows to assign the process to those test cases uploaded via Excel. But I still miss the possibility to upload the test cases in mass with the process ID, and avoid any effort related to reassignments.

Have you already tested this new functionality in your projects? How do you handle mass uploads and process assignments in Cloud ALM? Share your experience in the comments.

entry.title: SAP Integration SuiteのAI Adapterの使い方 Vol3.音声APIを試す
entry.content:
SAP Integration SuiteのAIアダプタがようやくリリースされたので試してみました。
この記事ではIntegration Suite AIアダプターの利用方法をステップバイステップで解説します。
最も基本的なAIアダプタ利用方法は、第1回の記事、第2回の記事を参考にして下さい。

第3回のテーマは、『Chat Completions API以外も呼び出してみよう』です。

AI Adapterについて

AI Adapterはその名の通り、対話型AIとやり取りをするために利用するアダプタです。
2025年2Qにリリースされたばかりの新アダプタとなります。

・AI アダプタでは、 SAP AI Coreを利用したAICore-GenAIHubと、Chat GPT APIを利用したCustom-OpenAI-RESTの2 つのAI利用方法があります。

この記事では第1回、第2回の記事に引き続き、後者のCustom-OpenAI-RESTを利用しAIアダプタを試してみます。

Open AI APIの種別

第1回、第2回の記事では、Chat Completions APIを利用してきました。
Chat Completions APIでは自然言語での応答作成、文章要約などができますが、Open AIのAPIはテキストで会話ができるだけではありません。

  • 音声合成(Text to Speech)
  • 音声認識(Speech to Text)
  • 音声翻訳(Speech Translation)
  • 画像生成(Text to Image)
  • 画像理解(Image Captioning / Analysis)
  • ファイルアップロード(Files): OpenAI APIにファイル(.txt, .jsonなど)をアップロードして後続APIに利用

第2回の記事で作ったiFlowを修正し、上記のAPIも呼び出せるか試してみます。
(そもそもIntegration Suiteでどのようなユースケースで利用するかは別として・・・ケイパビリティを確認しましょう)

第2回の記事のiFlowからの変更点を中心に示します。

1.Text to Speech APIを試す。

AIアダプタの設定：下図のようにText to Speech APIに変更する

Content Modifier設定：下図参照

{
  "model": "tts-1",
  "input": "Today is a wonderful day to develop Integration Flow",
  "voice": "alloy"
}

2.動作確認

トレースモードで実行したところ、AIアダプタからの戻り値にバイナリデータが含まれていました。ダウンロードしてみます。

エディタで開くと文字化けしています。

ダウンロードしたファイルはaudio/mpeg形式です。『output.mp3』にファイル名を変更し、再生してみます。

下記にoutput.mp3をアップロードしましたので、正しく生成されているか確認してみてください。https://drive.google.com/file/d/1__Yucju2dRmpf-GpWzIAjfJccbQhjeOl/view?usp=drive_link

次回は画像系のOpen AI APIを試そうと思います。

entry.title: Join the SAP Enterprise Architecture & Business Data Cloud APAC Event!
entry.content:
What You’ll Discover

  • Insights into modernizing SAP BW and building future-ready data platforms

  • Deep dives on SAP’s latest Data & AI strategies and real-world impact

  • Live Q&A with SAP leaders, including Irfan Khan, and special guests from the architecting and data communities

  • Technical best practices, hands-on sessions, and practical steps for enterprise architects facing BW modernization, hybrid landscapes, and integrated AI

Connect and Share

This is a not-to-be-missed event for SAP community members—whether an architect, data engineer, or business user. Meet peers, share knowledge, and build your network in a collaborative, welcoming environment. Be active, join the discussions, and take your SAP journey to the next level with up-to-date strategies and community spirit.

How to Sign Up

Ready to join? Visit the official SAP event page and register today to secure your spot. Seats fill up fast for live SAP sessions, so sign up early to benefit from deep insights and unmatched networking opportunities.

Let’s shape the future of enterprise architecture and data together—register now and be part of the innovation!

entry.title: Re: Default Purchasing Option in LMS
entry.content:
Hello @alper_kacar ,

The default purchasing option while creating new items is 'No Charge' and there are no changes made to this configuration. There are also no configuration in the system which affects this.

While scheduling/creating classes, the default purchasing option is set to 'Inherit item chargeback settings' which inherits the purchasing option set at item level.

So if you have some items without 'No Charge' purchasing option, you can change them to 'No Charge' and all the class related to the item will become 'No Charge' if purchasing option is set to 'Inherit item chargeback settings' at class level which is the default one.

In case this information helped you then please consider giving Kudos or accepting this post as solution.

Swapnil

entry.title: Re: How to Add Standard Columns to the Learning Item Conn...
entry.content:
Hello @Meredith-Kiewit ,

You can use SUBJ_AREA_1/2/3 to add categories to item using connector.

If you want to know how you can update categories using item connector then below are the steps:

  1. Navigate to System Administration > Configuration >System Configuration > CONNECTOR
  2. Update the following Item Connector values:

item.field.mapping.data.SUBJ_AREA_1=SUBJ_AREA_1
item.field.mapping.data.SUBJ_AREA_2=SUBJ_AREA_2
item.field.mapping.data.SUBJ_AREA_3=SUBJ_AREA_3

  1. Place the file in SFTP server with header SUBJ_AREA_1 and category ID under the column to add and run the Item connector. You can use SUBJ_AREA_2 and SUBJ_AREA_3 to add two more categories at the same time.

Here is a KBA for your reference: https://me.sap.com/notes/2761490/E

 If this information helped you then please consider giving Kudos or accepting this post as solution.

 Swapnil

entry.title: Re: Default Purchasing Option in LMS
entry.content:
@alper_kacar myaarpmedicare wrote:

Hi, items and classes we created in LMS always had the purchasing option "No Charge" until recently. But some users reported that the new items they created had another value than "No Charge" in purchasing options. Which created an issue with classes. We do not use any pricing in our system and users don"t want to change the purchasing option every time they create an item. According to this note "No Charge" is always the default option. (https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2376238 ) Are there any changes to this? Because we haven"t done any configuration that could affect purchasing options.

Hello @alper_kacar,
If "No Charge" was previously the default and now appears changed without any configuration updates, it may indicate a backend update or system patch affecting defaults. I recommend confirming with SAP Support whether any recent changes impacted purchasing option behavior, as per SAP Note 2376238.


Best Regards,
Kyla Ellis

entry.title: Re: "Item is in use and cannot be deleted"
entry.content:
Hello @user116 ,

The deletion of primary records (ex.: Items, classes, content objects, learners/user, domains, categories, curricula, locales, etc.) from Learning is discouraged and in many cases not possible through the front end of the application.

In most cases, the records cannot be deleted due to referential integrity constraints that have been built into the application: the primary records have interacted with other records in the database which has built a chain of relationships in the database structure.

This item could be used at multiple places in LMS, even if it has different revisions, substitute, pre-requisites, you will not be able to delete this item. 

You have 3 options to go around this:

  1. "INACTIVATE" the record as in most cases deletion of primary records is not supported in the system >
  2. When this option is unavailable, you may add 'Do Not Use' or a similar message of your choice to the record description and remove from catalog/library access >
  3. Contact our Professional Services team to have a script built to delete the entities.

For more information, refer this KBA:  2253851 - Unable to delete primary records in SAP SuccessFactors Learning - SAP for Me

If this information helped you then please consider giving Kudos or accepting this post as solution.

Swapnil

entry.title: Re: S/4 - Open Sales Order Report with Partialy Deliveries
entry.content:
Yes as you might be knowing, most of the standard sales order analytical cubes like I_SalesOrderItemCube are header/item–centric and do not join to the delivery item tables like LIKP/LIPS, or the goods movement data. Delivered quantity is stored in:

  • VBEP (schedule lines) – confirmed and delivered quantities
  • LIPS – actual delivery quantities
  • VBUK/VBUP – delivery status flags (in S/4, it is LIKP / LIPS)

The standard cube doesn’t bring these in because it’s meant for order intake analysis, not fulfilment tracking.


Try with any of the below options

Identify the standard cube closest to your needs like I_SalesOrderItemCube. Create a Custom CDS View (type: Cube) that extends it with:

  • Join to I_SalesOrderScheduleLine (for confirmed/delivered qty)
  • Or join to I_DeliveryDocumentItem (for actual delivered qty)

Add a calculated measure for Open Quantity. Use this extended cube in your Custom Analytical Query. In Private Cloud, you can do this in the Custom CDS Views app without developer keys.

The other option is start from I_DeliveryDocumentItem (contains reference sales order/item and actual delivered qty). Join to I_SalesOrderItemBasic to bring in order qty and other sales attributes.

entry.title: SAC View mode - Has the View Mode layout been updated?
entry.content:
I’ve noticed a change in how a story opens in View mode:

  • When I first open the story, View mode looks the same as before (image attached below). 

  • If I switch to Edit mode and then back to View, it now opens in a new layout.

  • Previously, that new window opened in the previous version of the viewer, but over the last few days it opens in the later/newer version instead.

Is this behavior part of a recent update?
If not, is there a tenant- or story-level setting that controls which viewer version is used when returning to View mode (and/or whether it opens in a new window)? Any pointers to the exact setting or documentation would be appreciated.

Thanks!

<After>

entry.title: Re: MMSC_MASS Missing LGORT Field
entry.content:
In your case, the LGORT is not showing could be because the MASS object for material master (BUS1001001 / MATERIAL) has field groups that control which key fields are available for selection. For the “Extend Storage Location” use case (MMSC_MASS), the key fields are Material and Plant by default. If the Storage Location field (LGORT) is not part of the key fields in the MASS object definition, you won’t see it in the initial selection screen — even though it exists in MARC/MARD.

This can happen if the MASS object was adjusted in customizing and LGORT was removed from the key fields. You’re using a variant of the MASS object that’s restricted to plant‑level extension. In S/4HANA, some storage‑location‑level data is only editable via MMSC (single) or via LSMW/BDC, not via MM17, unless the MASS object is enhanced.

So go to MASSOBJ, select Object type BUS1001001 or Material, go to Fields and check if LGORT is present and marked as a key field for the relevant table (MARD). If it’s missing, add it back and transport the change.

Next check is go to OMS9, make sure LGORT is not hidden for the views you’re trying to maintain. In S/4HANA, LGORT is an organizational level, not a “field” in the usual sense; so it must be part of the key structure for the MASS object.

In MM17, choose Data Type = “Storage Location Data for Material” (MARD) instead of “Plant Data” (MARC). This will give you LGORT as part of the selection.

entry.title: Re: How to pass long error messages (> 50 Char) as free t...
entry.content: Solution : Created A message class with Number pass(&1&2&3&4) as messages and in Bdef Call report = %msg = new_message( * id = '' * number = '00' * severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error * v1 = 'Error' * v2 = | for combination of Company Code: | * && | ,Gl Account| * v3 = |:| && ls_cl_error-gl_account * v4 = || && | ,Joint Venture Equity Group:| * && ls_cl_error-costcenter.
